questions.text: The hormone produced and released by the cell at the tip of the arrow binds to receptors on the surface of which of the following cells?
Which of the following structures prevents the upward extension of thyroid swelling through its attachment to the thyroid cartilage?
A militant presents with rashes all over his body sparing the palms and soles. On examination, he was febrile and lice were noted. Which of the following is responsible for his condition?

A 52-year-old female patient present with 4 cm diameter diagnosed breast cancer lesion with ipsilateral axillary and contralateral supraclavicular lymphadenopathy as shown below. As per AJCC system, patient belongs to which stage of breast cancer?
Which of the following is the correct sequence for correction of hypospadias surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Chordee correction, urethral mobilization, glanuloplasty, meatal advancement

options.label: B
options.text: Chordee correction, meatal advancement, urethral mobilization, glanuloplasty

options.label: C
options.text: Meatal advancement, chordee correction, glanuloplasty, urethral mobilization

options.label: D
options.text: Glanuloplasty, meatal advancement, urethral mobilization, chordee correction

questions.correct_answer: A. Chordee correction, urethral mobilization, glanuloplasty, meatal advancement
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Chordee correction, urethral mobilization, glanuloplasty, meatal advancement

questions.text: Match the suture with the most likely indication:
What will be the 95% confidence interval (CI) for an estimated prevalence of 10% and a sample size of 100?

options.label: D
options.text: Given data inadequate for calculation of class intervals

questions.text: An orthopedic resident has removed a K-wire from the fractured SCH of a 13-year-old boy. Where should he discard this?
questions.correct_answer: B. Cardboard box with blue marking
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Cardboard box with blue marking

questions.text: A 2-year-old child comes with the following finding. Identify the grade and management:
questions.correct_answer: D. X1B, 2 lakh IU vit A
questions.explanation: Ans. D) X1B, 2 lakh IU vit A

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding sodalime? 100 g of sodalime can absorb 23 liters of CO2 Amsorb is preferred for Sevoflurane and Desflurane over sodalime The major constituent of sodalime is Ca (OH)2 Water content of sodalime is 5% Can form a neurotoxic compound with Trilene
Identify the layer involved in the following disease: Pemphigus foliaceous Icthyosis Pemphigus vulgaris LCH Vitiligo

Identify the correct statements: Direct observation with a structured checklist is the best method to survey the injection practices of health workers. Mass drug administration done for Worm infestation, Vitamin A deficiency and Scabies. Innermost circle of Rule of haves denotes hypertensives getting treatment. Type A PHCs have >20deliveries per month
What is the appropriate size for ET tube for child aged 8?

A 21-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 0, at 36 weeks gestation is sent to the hospital for a blood pressure of 190/110 mm Hg in the office. The patient was prescribed insulin therapy for gestational diabetes at 28 weeks gestation but has been poorly compliant. On arrival, her blood pressure is 184/106 mm Hg. Initial laboratory results show elevated serum creatinine and transaminases. Blood glucose is 204 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows 4+ proteinuria. Nifedipine, magnesium sulfate, and insulin are administered. Induction of labor is started with oxytocin. Six hours later, the patient's blood pressure is 150/90 mm Hg. The patient now complaints of nausea, headache, generalized muscle weakness and respiratory distress. DTRs are absent. What is the likely cause of the findings?

A young female presented to you with primary amenorrhea. Examination reveals normal breast development and absent axillary and pubic hairs. Pelvic examination shows a normally developed vagina with clitoromegaly and micro-phallus. On ultrasound, masses are visible in the inguinal region. What is the most likely diagnosis?
All of the following are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: The shortest AP diameter of the pelvic inlet is the obstetric conjugate.

options.label: B
options.text: Diagonal conjugate is measured from tip of sacral promontory to the lower margin of pubic symphysis.

options.label: C
options.text: Obstetric conjugate is calculated by subtracting 1.5 cm from diagonal conjugate.

options.label: D
options.text: Contracted pelvis is defined as transverse diameter <10cm and AP diameter <12cm.

questions.correct_answer: D. Contracted pelvis is defined as transverse diameter <10cm and AP diameter <12cm.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Contracted pelvis is defined as transverse diameter <10 cm and AP diameter <12 cm

questions.text: Arrange the following in sequential order: MSAFP, E3, HCG, Inhibin-A TIFA scan Growth-Liquor scan NT-NB

A pregnant woman with G3P2L0 presented to you with a pregnancy at period of gestation of 9 weeks, She has a history of conization one year back currently on follow-up with no recurrence on PAP smear. She also has the history of preterm births at 30 weeks during her last pregnancy. What is your next step in the management of this patient?

A primigravida came to the labor room at 40 weeks +5 days gestation for induction of labor. On per vaginal examination, the cervix is 1 cm dilated and 30% effaced. The vertex is at -1 station and the cervix is soft and posterior. What will be the modified Bishop score for this lady?

A multiparous woman is in labor at 38 weeks of gestation. On examination, the uterus appears asymmetrical. In fundal grip, the fetal pole is not palpable and in pelvic grip, the lower pole of the uterus is empty. All of the following are true about the given presentation except:

options.label: A
options.text: Placenta previa should be ruled out

options.label: B
options.text: Uterine diadelphys is likely in the patient

options.label: C
options.text: There are high chances of cord prolapse in the patient

questions.correct_answer: B. Uterine diadelphys is likely in the patient
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Uterine diadelphys is likely in the patient

questions.text: 31-year-old woman comes to the AIIMS OPD due to a 6.8-kg weight gain over the last few months. She has been unable to lose weight despite rigorous dieting and regular exercise. The patient also has experienced weakness and cannot lift weights that she was able to lift before the onset of her symptoms. Her menstrual periods have been irregular for the last few months, and she has had increasing anxiety and insomnia for which she has started seeing a clinical psychologist. On examination, blood pressure is 160/100 mmHg and pulse is 88/min and regular. Neurologic examination shows proximal muscle weakness. Dark terminal hair is present on the lower abdomen. Fasting laboratory results are as follows. Glucose-130 mg/dL Sodium-142 mEq/L Potassium-3.6 mEq/L Chloride-98 mEq/L Bicarbonate-28 mEq/L Calcium-9.2 mg/dL TSH-2.2 mlU/L (N-0.5 to 5.0 mIU/L) Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in evaluating this patient's condition?
questions.correct_answer: B. Overnight low-dose dexamethasone suppression test
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Overnight low-dose dexamethasone suppression test

questions.text: 52-year-old woman with known liver cirrhosis comes to the emergency department with bright bleeding per rectum for 2 days. She also has increasing abdominal distension and discomfort. The patient has been on daily furosemide and spironolactone as well as water and sodium restriction. She had variceal banding after an episode of esophageal bleeding due to esophageal varices 3 months ago. There is 2+ peripheral pitting edema. Laboratory results as follows: Hemoglobin: 8.2 g/dL Leukocytes: 4,200/mm3 Blood urea nitrogen: 72 mg/dL Serum creatinine: 2.1 mg/dL Urine sodium: 9meq/l (N-20-220meq/l) No urinary casts Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's acute kidney injury?

38-year-old woman comes to the office with a 3-week history of weight loss, nausea, abdominal pain, and postural dizziness. She travelled to Thailand 6 months ago and has felt fatigued since then. Medical history is notable for moderate persistent asthma treated with an inhaled beta-2 agonist and inhaled corticosteroid. Over the last 2 years, the patient has had several asthma exacerbations requiring oral prednisone. She also has hypothyroidism treated with levothyroxine. The patient is married and is a stay-at-home mother. Blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg and pulse is 96/min. Skin examination shows increased pigmentation at the palmar creases and mucous membranes. Initial laboratory testing shows mild hyponatremia and hyperkalaemia with normal renal function Complete blood count is normal, but differential shows moderate eosinophilia. Follow-up testing confirms a low 8AM serum cortisol. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's adrenal insufficiency?

options.label: D
options.text: Central adrenal insufficiency from glucocorticoid use

questions.text: 67-year-old man comes to the emergency department with light-headedness and generalized weakness for the last 2 days. He has chronic stable angina with exertion. However, over the last 2 days he has also had occasional chest discomfort at rest. The patient's medical problems include hypertension and bronchial asthma. He has no shortness of breath, cough, or peripheral edema. His only medications are aspirin and isosorbide dinitrate. Blood pressure is 105/66 mm Hg. Electrocardiogram obtained in the emergency department is shown here. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

A 58-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a one-month history of progressive dyspnoea, generalized weakness, fatigue, and palpitations. He also reports tingling and numbness in both lower limbs. His daughter adds that since his wife's death a year ago, the patient has not been taking care of himself. Blood pressure is 105/50 mm Hg and pulse is 104/ min. Cardiovascular examination shows a displaced apical impulse at the sixth intercostal space, a third heart sound, and high-volume, collapsing carotid pulses. Bilateral basal crackles, 2+ bilateral pedal edema, and mild hepatomegaly are also present. Neurologic examination shows decreased light touch and vibration sense in the feet, with decreased knee and ankle reflexes bilaterally. Laboratory evaluation shows normal blood counts. Deficiency of which of the following nutrients is most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

A microbiologist performs a genetic experiment in which cultures of Escherichia coli are treated with a chemical that induces a high frequency of mutations. Individual bacterial colonies are isolated to identify a mutant strain that lacks a specific enzyme involved in DNA replication. This specific enzyme is responsible for removing short fragments of RNA that are base paired to the DNA template. Which of the following enzymes is most likely deficient in this strain of E coli?

A research scientist studying the metabolic pathways that contribute to obesity, feeds experimental animals a high-carbohydrate, high-protein diet for a prolonged period. A sample of liver tissue is then obtained from the animals, and the activity of various enzymes involved in fatty acid metabolism is measured and recorded. It is determined that beta-oxidation of fatty acids is inhibited within these cells because of the diet. An increase in which of the following substances is most likely responsible for the observed effect?

A 68-year-old man with a long history of using chewing tobacco comes to the office for follow up of squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) of the oral cavity. A month ago, the patient was diagnosed with SCC of the left lateral tongue. He underwent resection, the surgical specimen showed clear margins, and he started additional treatment. The patient recently noticed a second ulcerative lesion on the right lateral tongue. Biopsy is performed and it also shows SCC. The second tumor most likely arose from which of the following mechanisms?

A 33-year-old woman comes to the office due to intermittent dizziness. The patient describes a sensation of severe spinning accompanied by intense nausea that lasts 1-2 hours. She feels unsteady during these episodes and has to lie down with her eyes closed for relief. She also hears a "mechanical humming" sound in in her right ear during these episodes. The patient has no associated headaches, ear pain, or ear discharge. On examination, air conduction is greater than bone conduction in both ears. When the base of a tuning fork is placed against her forehead, the sound is heard more prominently in the left ear. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

32-year-old woman comes to the office for routine check up. Physical examination is unremarkable except for anisocoria. Pupillary examination findings in normal, bright, and dim light are shown in the image below. This patient's pupillary abnormality is likely due to a defect in which of the following pathways?

options.label: A
options.text: Optic nerve of the right eye

options.label: B
options.text: Parasympathetic innervation of the left eye

options.label: C
options.text: Parasympathetic innervation of the right eye

options.label: D
options.text: Sympathetic innervation of the right eye

questions.correct_answer: C. Parasympathetic innervation of the right eye
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Parasympathetic innervation of the right eye

questions.text: 14-year-old boy comes to the office due to right ear pain, pruritus, and discharge over the past week. He has had no cold symptoms, hearing loss, dizziness, or tinnitus. The patient returned yesterday from a a 2-week vacation at Goa, where he swam daily. Temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg, and pulse is 75/min. Manipulation of the right ear during otoscopy elicits pain. There is prominent swelling and erythema of the ear canal with purulent and crusty debris. The tympanic membrane appears normal and has normal mobility. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism of this patient's current condition?

A 60-year-old patient complains of decreased distant vision but he does not use spectacles for near vision. The image of his ocular examination is given below. What is this type of refractive error called?

A 34-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to severe headache. The patient describes unbearable, throbbing pain around his right eye that awakened him. Over the past week, he has had several similar episodes, which spontaneously resolved after 20-30 minutes. On physical examination, he appears restless and paces in the room. There is mild conjunctival injection and miosis of the right eye. Neurologic examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current symptoms?

62-year-old man comes for the evaluation of jaundice. Medical history is significant for uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus and morbid obesity. He does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. BMl is 47 kg/m2. Laboratory studies reveal elevated transaminases. A liver biopsy is obtained, and trichrome staining shows the following. Which of the following cells is directly responsible for the histologic finding indicated by the arrow?

35-year-old woman comes to the physician complaining of weakness, fatigue, and pallor. Physical examination is unremarkable except for conjunctival pallor. Laboratory results are as follows: Haemoglobin: 7.2 g/dL Mean corpuscular volume: 90 fL Reticulocytes: 0.1% Platelets: 280,000 /uL Leukocyte count: 6,700 cells/uL Iron studies and serum B12 and folic acid levels are within normal limits. Bone marrow biopsy shows absence of erythroid precursors but preserved myeloid and megakaryocytic elements. Further workup would most likely show which of the following?

38-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to vomiting blood. After appropriate resuscitation measures, he undergoes upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, which reveals a bleeding duodenal ulcer. During hospital day 2, the patient develops decreased urine output. Serum creatinine rises to 3.0 mg/dL from a baseline of 1.2 mg/dL. Renal biopsy shows patchy epithelial necrosis of the tubules, intratubular casts. Supportive care is provided. Several days later, his urine output significantly increases, and serum creatinine levels decline. Over the next few days, this patient is at highest risk for which of the following complications?
Which of the following would be the expected physical examination finding over the right lower chest?
Which of the following is not a common feature of ABPA?
Which of the following does not cause hardness of water?

On world health day, 4 senior faculty from various departments sit in front of audience to talk about a topic. The director of hospital welcome audience and introduces everyone. There is no specific agenda, no order of speaking, and no set speech. In the end, audience is invited to take part. Identify this method of communication:

A 23-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department unconscious after a motor vehicle accident. NCCT is shown here. A branch of which of the following arteries is most likely severed in this patient?
All of the following are true about endotoxin except:
Identify the plant shown below?

A 57-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to lethargy and altered mental status. His family suspects a suicide attempt. Medical history is significant for dilated cardiomyopathy and major depressive disorder. On arrival, blood pressure is 76/46 mm Hg, pulse is 38/min, and respirations are 16/min. Pupils are 3mm and reactive. Oropharynx is normal. Examination shows bilateral wheezing. There is no peripheral edema. Capillary refill is 3 seconds. There is no diaphoresis. Which of the following categories of medication did this patient most likely ingest?
Identify the true statement about the image given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Due to sulph-meth-hemoglobin accumulation and formation

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with a case of electrical burns

questions.correct_answer: B. Due to sulph-meth-hemoglobin accumulation and formation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Due to sulph-meth-hemoglobin accumulation and formation

questions.text: Arrange the following phases of cardiac cycle in sequential order from systole to diastole: S1 S4 y descent R wave

A 6-year-old male child was presented with a past of persistent cough and foul-smelling stools. His sibling, who had experienced comparable symptoms, passed away a few years earlier. Tests including the sweat chloride test and CFTR gene analysis were conducted and cystic fibrosis was diagnosed. What will happen to the transport of Chloride ions in sweat gland and pancreatic ducts respectively?
What characteristics define necrosis among the options provided? 1. Disrupted cell membrane 2. Induces inflammation 3. Swelling of the cell 4. Can be seen physiologically

A 2-week-old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents for evaluation of his umbilicus. The parents report that since the umbilical cord stump separated 2 days ago, there has been serous pale drainage from the umbilicus that increases when the patient cries. He is exclusively breastfed and continues to have normal wet diapers and stool output. Laboratory results are as follows: Hemoglobin: 14 g/dL Platelets: 240,000/mm3 TLC: 11,000/mm3 Neutrophils: 60% Lymphocytes: 32% Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's umbilical findings?

options.label: B
options.text: Incomplete closure of anterior abdominal wall

questions.text: A 35-year-old man comes to the clinic for evaluation of exertional dyspnea and dry cough for 8 months. Oxygen saturation on room air while lying down is 96% and drops to 88% after 6 minutes of walking. Examination shows fine crackles in both lower lungs. Chest x-ray reveals reticular densities in both lung fields. Lung biopsy shows an infiltration of inflammatory cells, predominantly lymphocytes, as well as poorly formed noncaseating granulomas and moderate alveolar septal fibrosis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following opioids is an antagonist at ‘µ’ and a complete agonist at ‘k’ receptors?

A 14-year-old girl is brought to the clinic by her mother for a yearly physical examination. The patient feels well but is worried that she has not yet started puberty. Temperature is 36.7°C (98°F), blood pressure is 152/91 mmHg, pulse is 75/min, and respirations are 18/ min. Physical examination is significant for a lack of secondary sexual characteristics; a blind vagina is noted on pelvic examination. Laboratory studies reveal hypokalemia and low testosterone and estradiol levels. Cytogenetic analysis shows a 46, XY karyotype. This patient most likely has deficiency of which of the following enzymes?
Which of the subsequent options is non-essential in the evaluation of mosaic Turner syndrome?

A 24-year-old G2 at 28 weeks is brought to the emergency after being found unconscious at home by her mother. She is disoriented on arrival and her BP is 180/110 mmHg and 4 + proteinuria. On arrival at the emergency, she has a tonic-clonic seizure which resolves with MgSO4 administration. Once the patient is stabilized, she undergoes caesarean delivery for fetal distress. Post-partum, the below MRI is done. What is the most likely finding on imaging?

A 65-year-old male presents with sepsis and purpura fulminans. Thromboelastography (TEG) is ordered to assess the patient's clotting profile. Which of the following TEG tracings is most consistent with the patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced R-time, increased angle, increased MA, increased LY30

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged R-time, decreased angle, decreased MA, decreased LY30

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced R-time, decreased angle, increased MA, decreased LY30

questions.correct_answer: C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30.

questions.text: Identify the given image:
Identify the artery marked by red arrow:
All are true about cephalosporins except:

options.label: A
options.text: Cefazolin is a first generation parenteral cephalosporin

options.label: C
options.text: Cefixime has poor activity against Staph aureus

options.label: D
options.text: Cefoxitin has no activity against anaerobes

questions.correct_answer: D. Cefoxitin has no activity against anaerobes

questions.text: The following device is used for all of the following indications except:
Identify the incorrectly matched pair with respect to its nerve supply of the marked structures in the given image:

Seven hours after undergoing left hip arthroplasty for chronic hip pain, a 67-year-old woman reports a prickling sensation in her left anteromedial thigh and lower leg. Neurologic examination shows left leg strength 3/5 on hip flexion and 2/5 on knee extension. Patellar reflex is decreased on the left. Sensation to pinprick and light touch are decreased on the anteromedial left thigh as well as medial lower leg. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms?

A 62-year-old man comes to the physician because of fatigue and decreased urine output for 2 weeks. He has not been to the physician for many years and takes no medications. Serum studies show a urea nitrogen concentration of 42 mg/dL and a creatinine concentration of 2.3 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows heavy proteinuria. A photomicrograph of a section of a kidney biopsy specimen is shown. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department because of a 2-day history of lower leg weakness, swallowing difficulty, and drooling of saliva. He has not yet received any childhood vaccinations. Two days after admission, the patient develops shortness of breath. Pulse oximetry shows an oxygen saturation of 64%. Despite resuscitative efforts, the patient dies of respiratory failure. At autopsy, examination of the spinal cord shows destruction of the anterior horn cells. Neurological examination of this patient would have most likely shown which of the following findings?

A 53-year-old man with hyperlipidemia comes to the physician for a follow-up examination. His home medications include acetaminophen and atorvastatin. Serum studies show elevated total cholesterol and triglyceride concentrations. A drug that activates the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha is added to his existing therapy. This patient is most likely to develop which of the following drug-related adverse effects?

options.label: C
options.text: Pruritus and flushing of the skin

questions.text: A 13-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department by his mother because of a 6-hour history of severe eye pain and blurry vision. He wears soft contact lenses and has not removed them for 2 days. Ophthalmologic examination shows a deep corneal ulcer, severe conjunctival injection, and purulent discharge on the right. Treatment with topical ciprofloxacin is initiated. A culture of the ocular discharge is most likely to show which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Gram-negative spiral bacteria visible on dark-field microscopy

questions.text: The World Health Organization suggests the use of a new rapid diagnostic test for the diagnosis of malaria in resource-limited settings. The new test has a sensitivity of 70% and a specificity of 90% compared to the gold standard test (blood smear). The validity of the new test is evaluated at a satellite health center by testing 200 patients with a positive blood smear and 150 patients with a negative blood smear. How many of the tested individuals are expected to have a false negative result?

A previously healthy 51-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of confusion for 2 hours. His wife reports that he fell and hit his head while changing a ceiling light the previous evening. On arrival, he is unconscious. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8ºF), pulse is 54/min, respirations are 8/min and irregular, and blood pressure is 198/106 mm Hg. The right pupil is dilated and fixed; the left pupil is round and reactive to light. There is extension of the extremities to painful stimuli. He is intubated and mechanically ventilated. A mannitol infusion is begun. A noncontrast CT scan of the brain shows herniation of the right medial temporal lobe. Which of the following is the most likely additional finding in this patient?

A 24-year-old man is evaluated due to an episode of syncope. He was jogging when he felt light-headed and passed out, but he did not sustain a head injury. The patient has had 2 similar episodes of light-headedness while jogging. The patient does not use tobacco, alcohol, or recreational drugs. His father died suddenly at age 30. On physical examination, the patient has a harsh systolic murmur. The lungs are clear to auscultation. This patient's symptoms are most likely explained by left ventricular outflow obstruction created by which of the following structures?

options.label: A
options.text: Aortic valve cusp and interventricular septum

options.label: B
options.text: Aortic valve cusp and papillary muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Mitral valve leaflet and interventricular septum

questions.correct_answer: D. Mitral valve leaflet and interventricular septum
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Mitral valve leaflet and interventricular septum

questions.text: A 34-year-old female is hospitalized with progressive exertional dyspnea, lower extremity edema and cough. She also describes frequent nocturnal episodes of breathlessness and recent hoarseness. Auscultation reveals loud first and second heart sounds and a mid-diastolic rumble best heard at the cardiac apex. This patient's hoarseness is most likely caused by:

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the physician with jaundice and pallor. He was adopted and his family history is unknown. Laboratory studies show anemia, reticulocytosis, and increased indirect bilirubin. A peripheral blood smear is shown. This patient is most likely to have which of the following additional findings?
Identify the nerve injured:
What is the likely genetic abnormality in the following patient?

A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD due to advanced prostate cancer with bone metastases. For the last 4 months, he has been treated with a GnRH agonist, which has significantly reduced his bone pain. However, the patient now reports discomfort at the anterior chest wall. Physical examination reveals bilateral, mildly tender enlargement of the breast tissue behind the nipple-areolar complex. Early initiation of which of the following medications would be most appropriate for preventing this patient's breast symptoms?
All of the following are correct about components of blood transfusion except:

options.label: A
options.text: Packed Red Blood Cells (PRBC) - Bottom of centrifuge

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the given image?

In which of the following vessels will the blood flow get affected if one puts a temporary clamp near the origin of the common hepatic artery? ﻿﻿﻿Right gastric ﻿﻿﻿Right gastroepiploic ﻿﻿﻿Replaced left hepatic ﻿﻿﻿Left gastroepiploic ﻿﻿﻿Left hepatic Superior pancreaticoduodenal
The caecum is found to be placed below the stomach and is midline. Which of the following abnormalities must have taken place while rotation of the gut?

A young female patient complains of low back pain radiating to the right hip, back of the thigh, leg, and ankle after an intense workout of lifting some heavy weights. MRI shows the following finding. Which function will be weak here?
Identify the ethmoidal cells shown in the CT:
Palmer's point is the point where you would insert the Veress needle. Identify it

options.label: A
options.text: 3 cm below the left costal margin at the mid-clavicular line

options.label: B
options.text: 7 cm below the left costal margin at the mid-clavicular line

options.label: C
options.text: 3 cm below the right costal margin at the mid-axillary line

options.label: D
options.text: 7 cm below the right costal margin at the mid-clavicular line

questions.correct_answer: A. 3 cm below the left costal margin at the mid-clavicular line
questions.explanation: Ans. A) 3 cm below the left costal margin at the mid-clavicular line

questions.text: Identify the X-linked disorder from the options below:
A patient develops gastroenteritis after eating raw seafood. Culture shows the Kanagawa phenomenon on Wagatsuma agar. Which statement about the organism is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Produces yellow colonies on TCBS agar

options.label: B
options.text: Causes disease via zonula occludens breakdown

options.label: D
options.text: Exhibits safety pin appearance under microscopy

questions.correct_answer: D. Exhibits safety pin appearance under microscopy
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Exhibits safety pin appearance under microscopy

questions.text: A study on 2000 children assessed the link between screen time and Autism spectrum. 1600 had >2hours/day exposure. The correlation coefficient was r = 0.9 (p = 0.03). What does this imply?

options.label: A
options.text: Study is invalid due to low p-value

options.label: B
options.text: No correlation between screen time and ADHD

options.label: C
options.text: Data is insufficient to conclude correlation

options.label: D
options.text: Valid study with strong positive correlation

questions.correct_answer: D. Valid study with strong positive correlation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Valid study with strong positive correlation

questions.text: The histological image of a 45 year old male with colitis is shown. Which of the following treatment regimens is most appropriate?
What is the likely mechanism of Vesamicol?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits choline uptake at nerve endingst

options.label: B
options.text: Prevents acetylcholine release from presynaptic terminals

options.label: C
options.text: Blocks acetylcholine entry into storage vesicles

options.label: D
options.text: Enhances acetylcholine breakdown in the synaptic cleft

questions.correct_answer: C. Blocks acetylcholine entry into storage vesicles
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Blocks acetylcholine entry into storage vesicles

questions.text: A 32-year-old Rh-negative G2P1 woman at 35 weeks with no prior anti-D prophylaxis has a current antibody titer of 1:32. MCA peak systolic velocity is 1.7 MoM. What is the best next step?
During exercise, which organ system maintains constant blood flow?
Which of the following is the best method for detecting and localization of tumors associated with pheochromocytomas?
Which of the following terms describes nuclides that have identical atomic mass numbers but different atomic numbers?
A 36-year-old woman, smoker with irregular work hours and heavy periods, seeks contraception. She desires future fertility. What is the best option?

26-year-old female presented with mild pain in lower abdomen. She has had 2 full-term normal deliveries earlier. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks back. On pelvic examination, you find a palpable mass in the adnexa. USG pelvis is shown here. What is the next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Observation and follow-up for cyst after 2-3 months

questions.correct_answer: A. Observation and follow-up for cyst after 2-3 months
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Observation and follow-up for cyst after 2-3 months

questions.text: Patient with arsenic poisoning is treated with BAL (British anti-lewisite). Which complex of the electron transport chain is inhibited by this compound?
Wernicke’s encephalopathy develops secondary to accumulation of which substrate?
A G2P1 woman is suspected to have absent Nitabuch membrane. Which ultrasound finding most supports this diagnosis?
A 52-year-old man presents with a deep soft tissue mass on the thigh. Histology is shown. Molecular testing shows t(12;16). What is the likely diagnosis?
A 40-year-old male presents with poor urinary stream, hesitancy, and straining. He has a history of pelvic trauma a year ago. Which is the most appropriate initial investigation?
Which of the following tests will be positive in the urine of a patient who has undergone prolonged starvation?
A fisherman develops a well-demarcated, reddish skin lesion on his hand, without any pus. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old female presents to emergency department with pain in right hip and is unable to walk. She gives a history of fall in bathroom. On examination, you observe that there is shortening of left lower limb and is externally rotated. There is no history of arthritis. X-ray of hip is given below. What will be the management?
A 25-year-old man reports persistent heartburn is diagnosed with Type B gastritis. Which of the following findings does not align with this diagnosis?
A 27-year-old presents with ascending flaccid paralysis and is suspected to have Guillain-Barré Syndrome. Which of the following features is not consistent with this diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Fever at onset of weakness
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Fever at onset of weakness

questions.text: Identify the cylinder:

An obese diabetic patient presents with abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting. His pH is 7.2, urine is positive for ketones and glucose, and blood glucose is 130 mg/dL. Which drug is most likely responsible?

44-year-old man comes to the emergency department for exertional dyspnea, abdominal distention, and abdominal discomfort. He has a history of alcohol abuse, peptic ulcer disease, and acute pancreatitis. Physical examination shows a distended abdomen with shifting dullness and 1+ ankle edema. A diagnostic paracentesis is performed and shows the following: Albumin-2.5 g/dL Neutrophils-200/uL Blood studies show the following: Albumin-3.8 g/dL Glucose-120 mg/dL Aspartate aminotransferase-50 units/L Alanine aminotransferase (ALT)-40 units/L Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's ascites?
Which condition could result in the abnormality seen in the given placental image?

options.label: A
options.text: Chorionic plate larger than basal plate

options.label: D
options.text: Chorionic plate smaller than basal plate

questions.correct_answer: D. Chorionic plate smaller than basal plate
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Chorionic plate smaller than basal plate

questions.text: A 45-year-old lady presents with post-coital bleed. On examination, there is presence of cervical ulcerated lesion and hypertrophy with a healthy vagina. What will be next step in management?
A 30-year-old woman (P3L3) reports bright red vaginal bleeding 2 weeks after a normal vaginal delivery. What is the most likely cause of this delayed postpartum hemorrhage?
What is the most common type of fistula-in-ano according to the Parks classification?
The intravenous pyelogram of a patient is shown below What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 21-year-old man presents with a neck swelling. He underwent surgical removal of pheochromocytoma 6 months ago. He also has the following eye finding. What condition should he now be evaluated for?
A young man believes he is being followed by an identical-looking person dressed just like him. What is the most likely diagnosis?
By the year 2030, what are the Sustainable Development Goal targets for reducing neonatal and under-5 mortality rates per 1000 live births, respectively?
Which of the following is not a paired dural venous sinus?

A male patient with a history of hypermature cataract presents with a 2 day history of ciliary congestion, photophobia, blurring of vision and on examination has a deep anterior chamber in the right eye. The left eye Is normal. The diagnosis is:
A child presents with tall stature, slender fingers, blue eyes, and bilateral lens subluxation as shown. The likely metabolic disorder is due to impaired metabolism of which amino acid?
Which of the following combinations are associated with an increased risk of gallstone formation? Ileal resection Vagal stimulation High caloric diet Octreotide therapy

A woman undergoes an emergency cesarean section and soon after develops respiratory distress, cyanosis, hypotension, and altered sensorium. What is the most likely type of respiratory failure involved?
Which of the following statements about vitiligo is incorrect?

options.label: B
options.text: Shows milky-white fluorescence under Wood's lamp

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient complaints of a swelling in one side of the neck. She is afraid of eating food as it is painful. Imaging was performed and shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Isolated osteoma of floor of mouth

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman with SLE on long-term steroids undergoes uneventful laparoscopic appendectomy. Postoperatively, she develops refractory hypotension. What is the most appropriate immediate management?
A 25 year old animal rescue worker presents with itchy skin lesions on the abdomen as shown. Which of the following organisms is least likely to cause this presentation?
A 62-year-old woman presents with fever, dysuria, and recent onset of drowsiness, apathy, is claiming to be seeing bugs crawling under her skin. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In a case of anisocoria that is more pronounced in bright light, 1% pilocarpine fails to constrict the dilated pupil. What is the most likely cause?
A patient shows persistently low SpO₂ readings (80–85%) despite 100% oxygen flow. Which condition is likely responsible?
A 2-year-old girl presents with jaundice, abdominal pain in the right hypochondrium. MR imaging is shown below. What is the most likely classification?
During a modified radical mastectomy, the pectoralis minor and level III lymph nodes are removed while preserving the pectoralis major. Which procedure was performed?
What is primarily assessed using the digit span test?

A 2-day-old boy is evaluated in the newborn nursery for a diffuse rash that developed this morning and appears on the patient's face, chest, abdomen, and extremities. His mother occasionally develops cold sores during stressful events, most recently a year ago. The mother also had chickenpox as a child. Physical examination shows scattered, blanching, erythematous papules and pustules that spare the palms and soles. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial blood culture and intravenous antibiotics

options.label: B
options.text: Contact isolation and cessation of breastfeeding

options.label: D
options.text: Viral DNA testing and intravenous antiviral therapy

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy experiences facial and lip swelling after emotional stress. Which oral plasma kallikrein inhibitor can be used prophylactically?
A patient presented with unilateral proptosis and bilateral abducent palsy. What is the most probable cause?
Which drug used for treating pulmonary arterial hypertension is not administered orally?
A patient with gastroparesis is started on prucalopride. Which receptor does this drug act upon?
A penile scraping is shown below. If the patient develops encephalitis, which brain lobe is most likely affected?
Which neurotransmitter alteration is commonly seen in obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)?
In determining nutrient requirements for a population, which of the following nutrients is not included in the calculation for Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) for 97.5% of the population?
Following surgery for varicose veins, a patient develops sensory loss in the medial lower leg and foot. He will also have sensory loss in which part?
Arrow-headed fingers on X-ray is suggestive of:

A 60-year-old woman presents with acute chest pain and breathlessness. Pleural fluid analysis shows: Pleural fluid/serum Protein ratio = 0.6 Pleural fluid/serum LDH ratio = 0.6 Pleural fluid Glucose = 65 mg/dL Which is the most likely because of her pleural effusion?

A 23-year-old woman involved in a car fire presents to the ER. She is alert, oriented, with stable vitals. On examination, blisters are noted on the hard palate and the nasal hairs are singed. What should be the immediate next step in her management?

options.label: B
options.text: Follow her saturation closely and intubate if it drops below 94%

options.label: C
options.text: Administer oxygen through bag and mask

options.label: D
options.text: Secure the airway with endotracheal intubation

questions.correct_answer: D. Secure the airway with endotracheal intubation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Secure the airway with endotracheal intubation

questions.text: A pregnant woman at 35 weeks with BP 170/110 mmHg and 3+ proteinuria develops seizures. What is the most appropriate immediate step?
A 40-year-old man presents with testicular and renal tumors. Imaging also reveals parathyroid and pituitary adenomas. Which chromosome is the mutated gene most likely located on?
A 20-year-old woman presents with abdominal pain, joint pain, tendon xanthomas, and xanthelasma. Lab tests reveal high cholesterol, and genetic testing shows ABCG8 mutations. What is the diagnosis?
A 28 weeks pregnant female presents with the fetal distress on examination and the test performed (Umbilical artery Doppler study) is given below. What should be the next step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Give steroid cover and monitor with Doppler and BPP, and plan delivery

options.label: C
options.text: Give steroid and take up for CS immediately

options.label: D
options.text: Go for normal vaginal delivery as baby is very small

questions.correct_answer: B. Give steroid cover and monitor with Doppler and BPP, and plan delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Give steroid cover and monitor with Doppler and BPP, and plan delivery

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy comes to the OPD due to a skin condition. For the last 3 years, he has had small "pimples" on the posterior surface of her upper arms. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis of this patient's skin condition?
A town with a population of 5,00,000 examined 2000 blood slides for malaria in one year. Of these, 250 were found to be positive. What is the Annual Parasite Incidence (API)?

A man presented with worsening motor weakness. He initially walked with short, jerky steps unaided, but later developed a crossed gait and now needs a stick for balance. A toxin is suspected. The enzyme involved is lysyl oxidase. Which cofactor does this enzyme require?
An elderly man on chronic morphine therapy reports no bowel movement for 4 days. What is the best treatment?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department for difficulty breathing and a productive cough. He has a past medical history of recurrent episodes of sinusitis and otitis media. The respiratory infections typically have a protracted course but respond to high-dose antibiotic therapy. Pulmonary auscultation shows crackles and wheezing. CXR is shown. Which of the following is most likely to be dysfunctional in this patient?
A 28-year-old male with hypokalemia, metabolic alkalosis, and positive family history presents with muscle weakness and cramps. Which drug should be avoided?
What is one key advantage of transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) compared to electroconvulsive therapy (ECT)?
A school study measured and compared the heights of students from grade 5 to 10. Which statistical test is most appropriate?
A 60-year-old male has persistent unilateral nasal blockage and occasional blood-stained discharge. Biopsy and histology are shown. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following ossification centers is not present at birth?
A patient presents with hypertension. He has a history of chronic kidney disease and has experienced a few episodes of renal colic. Which diuretic is the most appropriate to use?
Which of the following is not included in the active management of third stage of labor to prevent post partum haemorrhage (PPH)?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxytocin within 1 minute of delivery of placenta

options.label: B
options.text: Delayed clamping and ligation of cord

questions.correct_answer: A. Oxytocin within 1 minute of delivery of placenta

questions.text: According to Casper’s dictum, what is the correct order of decomposition rate in different environments?
Which finding best differentiates delirium from Alzheimer’s dementia?
questions.correct_answer: D. Acute onset with impaired consciousness
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Acute onset with impaired consciousness

questions.text: In the campaign shown in the image, what does the acronym stand for?

options.label: A
options.text: Social Awareness and Action plan to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully

options.label: B
options.text: Society Act and Awareness plan to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully

options.label: C
options.text: Social Act and Action plan to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully

options.label: D
options.text: Society Achievement and Activity to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully

questions.correct_answer: A. Social Awareness and Action plan to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Social Awareness and Action plan to Neutralise Pneumonia Successfully

questions.text: A primigravida is undergoing a routine antenatal check. Which findings listed below are not physiological in pregnancy?
You find a methotrexate vial partially used in the ward. What is the correct method of disposing of this cytotoxic drug?
Which electrolyte imbalance can worsen digoxin toxicity?
During intubation, the anesthetist uses the (Backward, upward, Rightward Pressure) BURP maneuver. Which of the following statements is correct about this technique?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used for airway assessment

options.label: B
options.text: It is a form of internal laryngeal manipulation

options.label: D
options.text: It is useful in difficult airways

questions.correct_answer: D. It is useful in difficult airways
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It is useful in difficult airways

questions.text: In a patient with advanced sarcoidosis affecting the lungs, what is the most expected finding on investigation?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased DLCO with increased A-a gradient

options.label: B
options.text: Increased DLCO with decreased A-a gradient

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased DLCO with decreased A-a gradient

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased DLCO with increased A-a gradient

questions.correct_answer: D. Decreased DLCO with increased A-a gradient
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Decreased DLCO with increased A-a gradient

questions.text: During an online consultation, a patient says, “I’m doing finertends” and is known to use made-up words frequently. What type of thought disorder does this represent?
Microscopy of cervical secretions shows the following seen in a particular menstrual phase. What would vaginal cytology likely reveal in this phase?
A 56-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes has marfanoid features and pheochromocytoma. Which hypoglycemic drug should be avoided?

14-year-old girl is brought to the OPD by her mother because she has not started menstruating. Height is at the 15th percentile and weight is at the 20th percentile for age. There is no breast development or axillary hair. Pelvic examination reveals normal external female genitalia and no pubic hair. Ultrasound confirms the presence of a uterus. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?
A 46-year-old man presents with fever, joint pains, fatigue. His tests show HCV RNA and anti-HCV IgG positive. What is the best drug regimen?

You are examining a multigravida in the second stage of labor for the past two hours. On examination, contractions are adequate, the cervix is fully dilated with the head at station 0 with moulding 2+ and caput 2+. The sagittal suture is in the right occipito-transverse position. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats/minute. Which of the following is carried out for the management of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Wait for an hour for spontaneous labor

questions.text: Identify the drug that is both a phosphodiesterase 3 inhibitor and increases calcium binding to troponin C used in heart failure?
What is the lifetime prevalence of schizophrenia in a monozygotic twin of a patient with schizophrenia?

A 32-year-old woman, gravida 3 para 2, at 38 weeks gestation comes to the hospital due to contractions. She had a cesarean delivery for breech presentation at 39 weeks gestation in her second pregnancy. Blood pressure is 100/60 mmHg, pulse is 100/min, and respirations are 22/min. Fetal heart rate tracing shows moderate variability, multiple accelerations, and no decelerations. Uterine contractions are regular and occur every 4 minutes. The cervix is 6 cm dilated and 60% effaced, and the fetal vertex is at 0 station. After 2 hours, the patient is suddenly restless and has intense lower abdominal pain. Fetal heart monitoring shows recurrent late decelerations. On pelvic examination, there is moderate vaginal bleeding, the cervix is 6 cm dilated and 60% effaced, and the fetal vertex is at -3 station. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Which of the following does not provide passive immunity?

A middle-aged obese individual with elevated liver enzymes is diagnosed with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) and moderate-to-advanced liver fibrosis. Which recently approved medication is indicated for this condition?
Which of the following regions contain only thick filaments and no thin filaments?
75-year-old woman develops tense, itchy bullae and blisters. Immunofluorescence shows a linear pattern and histopathology is shown. Which of the following is true regarding the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Blisters form in the suprabasal layer

questions.text: A 35-year-old multiparous woman has stress urinary incontinence (SUI) that persists despite performing Kegel exercises for six months. Which medication can be used as part of her conservative management?

An intraoperative frozen section has been sent by a surgeon to the pathology laboratory. A special stain has been applied by the pathologist as empty looking areas were found after routine staining resulting in inability to make any diagnosis. Identify the special stain used?
A child presents with severe freckling and sunburn after brief sun exposure. Which DNA repair defect is responsible for the disorder?

A 23-year-old woman receives 1 unit of packed RBCs for PPH. Two hours later, she develops fever, chills, and mild breathlessness. There is no jaundice, dark urine, or hypotension. Cardiovascular exam is normal. What is the most likely cause of this transfusion reaction?
Which of the following substances is used for sample collection in a tube for blood alcohol concentration measurement?
A 24-year-old woman with focal seizures is prescribed ezogabine. What is the drug’s mechanism of action?
Which of the following is not a recognized complication of Rapid Sequence Intubation (RSI)?
A 1-year-old child who died of heart failure shows multiple ventricular tumors on autopsy. Histology suggests the following. What is the likely diagnosis?
The following ERCP image of the ampulla shows characteristic features of which pancreatic lesion?
Which of the following features is most consistent with hyponatremia due to SIADH?
questions.correct_answer: A. Euvolemia, UNa >40 mmol/L, Uosm >100 mOsm/kg

questions.text: Which of the following pairs are correctly matched regarding the methylene blue 3-swab test findings and their interpretations? The uppermost swab gets wet but not stained – Ureterovaginal fistula The uppermost swab gets stained – Vesicovaginal fistula The middle swab gets stained – Vesicovaginal fistula The lowermost swab gets stained – Urethrovaginal fistula

A patient with cirrhosis presents to the emergency department with an altered sleep cycle. When asked to draw a star, the patient is unable to do so accurately. He appears agitated. On examination, flapping tremors are noted. Which of the following does not form a part of the treatment?
All of the following are true about Cryptococcus neoformans infection except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is an opportunistic fungal infection

options.label: D
options.text: Pigeon droppings are a major environmental source

questions.text: All are true regarding the following condition except:

options.label: A
options.text: It typically affects the diaphysis of long bones in children and adolescents

options.label: B
options.text: "Onion-skin" periosteal reaction is a classic radiologic feature

options.label: C
options.text: It commonly metastasizes to the lungs

options.label: D
options.text: It presents with elevated serum alkaline phosphatase levels

questions.correct_answer: D. It presents with elevated serum alkaline phosphatase levels
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It presents with elevated serum alkaline phosphatase levels

questions.text: The image below corresponds to a Mullerian anomaly. Which of the following statements is incorrect about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Pregnancy can occur in a non-communicating rudimentary horn

options.label: B
options.text: It is a class I type of Mullerian agenesis

options.label: D
options.text: Has a functional uterus with normal cervix

questions.correct_answer: B. It is a class I type of Mullerian agenesis
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is a class I type of Mullerian agenesis

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding the RHIME model except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is used to determine causes of maternal death using verbal autopsy

options.label: B
options.text: Data is collected by trained SRS field workers

options.label: C
options.text: Final cause of death is assigned solely by a single expert physician

options.label: D
options.text: Stands for Representative, Re-sampled, Routine Household Interview of Mortality with Medical Evaluation.

questions.correct_answer: C. Final cause of death is assigned solely by a single expert physician
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Final cause of death is assigned solely by a single expert physician

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with cervical cancer has imaging showing tumor spread to the pelvic wall, para-aortic lymph node involvement, and hydronephrosis. According to FIGO staging, what is the correct stage?
A 16-year-old girl presents with primary amenorrhea and is diagnosed with Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome. Which of the following is not seen in this condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Axillary and pubic hair is present

questions.text: All are true regarding the GATHER approach except:

options.label: A
options.text: It includes helping the client make health decisions

options.label: B
options.text: It involves a return visit for follow-up

options.label: C
options.text: It is used mainly for psychiatric therapy sessions

options.label: D
options.text: It includes explaining all aspects of the decision

questions.correct_answer: C. It is used mainly for psychiatric therapy sessions
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It is used mainly for psychiatric therapy sessions

questions.text: The following image shows liver histology from a patient. Which feature is not commonly found in this condition?
A red-stained cloth from a crime scene is brought to a forensic lab to identify species origin. Which test is used?

A 35-year-old female who completed her family attended the gynaecology OPD with complaints of dysmenorrhoea, dyspareunia, painful defecation and urination. Sometimes she complained of pelvic pain before the start of menstruation. The doctor made a diagnosis of endometriosis and planned for a vaginal hysterectomy. During the surgery, the surgeon injured the ureter even after discharging his duty with care during the operation. The patient now filed a medical negligence case in court. According to which of the following doctrines is the doctor not negligent in the above-said case?
Identify the drug which has exclusive action shown in the graph without any other change in the action potential:
A 20-year-old male reports brief, recurring episodes of altered visual perception. He admits to using a drug via a blotting paper. Which substance is most likely involved?
